Definition: Anonymized digital information about a device, app crashes, errors and performance that is shared with Awana Digital. People using CoMapeo can opt-out of sharing this information at any time. This diagnostic information is completely anonymized and it never contains any of our users’ data (the data you have collected with CoMapeo). Diagnostic information does not include data about how users use the app, and it never includes any of the data users have collected with the app. Awana Digital does not collect users’ precise or coarse location, only the country where they are using CoMapeo.
used by: app users, comms, field teams, technical accompaniment

Definition:
Currently… Early Access is a term we use to describe the MVP and pre-Named Release stages of CoMapeo Mobile and Desktop which are still under development even if available to try and use.

Coming Soon… Early Access will be an actual opt-in / opt-out feature that allows intermediate and advanced tech users to try out new features currently available for field testing. Devices on the same project might not all be using Early Access and CoMapeo helps facilitate this among participants within a Project.

In the case of organizations that include non-community members (e.g. PUINAMUDT advisors, Amazon Frontlines, etc.), our decisions are informed and respectful of the considerations and practices of local communities towards these members. “Do they consider them fully included?”, “Which aspects are accessible to them?”, “Are they involved in decision making?”, etc.

Definition:
CoMapeo’s core feature that enables a person to create a digital note about something at a specific location and specific time. Photo or audio recordings can be added to help show what was observed.

The observation can include descriptions (like "the leaves were bright green") and numbers (like "12 birds were counted"). Whenever possible, the location where the observation was made is included as well, either automatically by CoMapeo or manually by a person using CoMapeo.

used by: Internal only, deep accompaniment
Other suggested terms: Example : The user is allowed to reset their password once they have received a password reset email. The email should contain a unique link for resetting the password and that link should expire after two hours.

Definition: In tech, user stories emphasize the user’s perspective, addressing a single goal or interaction. Usually one sentence following this structure : As a _______, I want to ___________ so that I ___________________
used by: Internal only, deep accompaniment
Other suggested terms: Example : As a user, I want to be able to reset my password so I can get back into the system if I forget it.

Definition:
Merging code without review.

Normally, code is reviewed before being merged. “YOLO merging” skirts this. It asks forgiveness, not permission.

Typically, this is for trivial, non-controversial changes. It can be a bit risky.
used by: developers (external)
